articles.author: NAJIB JOBAIN, WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli forces on Tuesday expanded their ground offensive into urban refugee camps in central Gaza after bombarding the crowded Palestinian communities and ordering residents to evacuate.
articles.title: Israeli military says Gaza ground offensive has expanded into urban refugee camps

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The doctors gave Shaimaa Nabahin an impossible choice: lose your left leg or risk death. The 22-year-old had been hospitalized in Gaza for around a week, after her ankle was partially severed in an Israeli airstrike, when doctors told her she was suffering from blood poisoning.
articles.title: Lose a limb or risk death? Growing numbers among Gaza's thousands of war-wounded face hard decisions

articles.author: ANNE D’INNOCENZIO and HALELUYA HADERO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Holiday sales rose this year and spending remained resilient during the shopping season even with Americans wrestling with higher prices in some areas and other financial worries, according to the latest measure.
articles.title: Americans ramped up spending during the holidays despite some financial anxiety and higher costs

articles.author: ALI SWENSON and CHRISTINE FERNANDO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Nearly three years after rioters stormed the U.S. Capitol, the false election conspiracy theories that drove the violent attack remain prevalent on social media and cable news: suitcases filled with ballots, late-night ballot dumps, dead people voting.
articles.title: As social media guardrails fade and AI deepfakes go mainstream, experts warn of impact on elections

articles.author: COLLEEN SLEVIN
articles.description: DENVER (AP) — Police said Tuesday they are investigating incidents directed at Colorado Supreme Court justices and providing extra patrols around their homes in Denver following the court's decision to remove former President Donald Trump from the state's presidential primary ballot.
articles.title: Police investigating incidents involving Colorado justices after Trump removed from state's ballot

articles.author: MIKE SCHNEIDER
articles.description: ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) — Disney has filed a lawsuit claiming that the oversight government for Walt Disney World, which was taken over by appointees of Gov.
articles.title: Disney says in lawsuit that DeSantis-appointed government is failing to release public records

articles.author: EDGAR H. CLEMENTE
articles.description: HUIXTLA, Mexico (AP) — Under a beating sun, thousands of migrants in a caravan continued to trudge through southern Mexico on Tuesday, with some saying they expect nothing good from an upcoming meeting this week between American and Mexican officials about the migrant surge at the U.S.
articles.title: Migrant caravan slogs on through southern Mexico with no expectations from a US-Mexico meeting

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — For holding a sign outside a courthouse reminding jurors of their right to acquit defendants, a retiree faces up to two years in prison. For hanging a banner reading “Just Stop Oil” off a bridge, an engineer got a three-year prison sentence.
articles.title: The right to protest is under threat in Britain, undermining a pillar of democracy

articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — Mexico launched its army-run airline Tuesday, when the first Mexicana airlines flight took off from Mexico City bound for the Caribbean resort of Tulum.
articles.title: Mexico's army-run airline takes to the skies, with first flight to the resort of Tulum

articles.author: LARRY LAGE
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — The Detroit Pistons have made NBA history.Detroit became the league's first team to lose 27 straight games in a season, falling 118-112 to the Brooklyn Nets on Tuesday night.
articles.title: Pistons lose NBA single-season record 27 straight games, falling to Nets 118-112
